main event: A sighting report from a witness in Merced, California on April 17, 1949, detailing observations of a spheroid object making a clicking noise.
interesting points: The object was described as having a diameter of 4 to 5 feet and appeared to be a dull surfaced light metal., The object maneuvered in an arc of approximately 90 degrees while making a continuous clicking noise., The witness estimated the object was in sight for about 35 seconds before it suddenly disappeared when the clicking noise stopped., There was no visible exhaust trail from the object during the sighting., A separate piece linked to a Japanese balloon was also reported in the investigation of this event.
witness description: Witness reported the object as moving slowly at first, then rapidly, with reflections of ground lights being the only source of light observed.
